tutorial.part:
Welcome to MArcomage

Greetings player. This tutorial will briefly guide you throughout MArcomage and will explain basic functionality on the way. While in the tutorial mode you may not interact with MArcomage functionality, but you can resize and reposition this dialog to allow you to inspect the content. You may also decide to skip this tutorial by pressing the Skip tutorial button at any time. This tutorial can be restarted by pressing the Restart tutorial button in the Settings section.

We are now located in the Webpage section. Here you can read about latest MArcomage news such as new features, new cards and latest balance changes.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to the Games section.

Games section

The screen is divided into two parts. The left screen contains list of your active games to allow you to access and play your games. Right now the list of active games is empty, but once you create a new game, the game can be accessed by pressing the > button located in the active games list row.

The right part of the screen contains games management. With it, you are able to create new games or join games created by other players. AI games (games against computer opponent) are also created here. We will now create a new game for you.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to your newly created game in the Game section.

Game section

Each player has exactly eight cards in his or hers hand. Your cards are located at the upper part of the screen. Opponent's cards are located in the bottom part of the screen. On your turn you can play a card by selecting it (clicking on it) and pressing the Play button. Of course, you need to have enough resources to pay for the card cost.

There are three types of resources: Bricks, Gems and Recruits, and three types of resource production facilities: Quarry, Magic and Dungeon. Bricks are the basic building material, used mostly for constructing buildings. Gems represent the magical power at your disposal. And finally, recruits represent your living or fighting power. At the end of round, for each facility of certain type, one resource of the corresponding type is added to player's stock. Your resources and facilities are located in the center-left part of the screen. Opponent's resources and facilities are located in the center-right part of the screen.

Every player has tower and wall. Tower height can be at most 100 (150 in long mode), wall has height limit 150 (225 in long mode). In the case of a standard enemy attack, the attack will first lower the wall. Only after the wall height is zero and some attack power still remains will the tower be lowered. There are some cards that do damage the tower directly, bypassing the wall. Tower and wall information are located in the bottom-left part (yours) and bottom-right (opponent's).

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Decks section.

Decks section

In this section you can see list of your decks and information about them. Each player starts with three pre-built starter decks. In the beginning it's advised to use these decks to play with, but with time you may want to adjust these decks and even create new ones. To inspect a deck click on the > button located in the deck list row. We will inspect one of your starter decks now.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Deck section.

Deck section

Card pool is located in the upper part of the screen. It contains all cards that are available for selection. Below it, your deck is located. To hide the card pool push the Hide card pool button located in the upper-right part of the screen. Once it's hidden, Hide card pool button is changed to Show card pool button which can be used to show the card pool once again. Card pool can be adjusted by using various filters that are located in the upper-left part of the screen.

To take a card from card pool to your deck, simply click on it. You can remove a card from your deck by clicking on it in your deck.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Deck section.

Messages section

Challenges and private messages that you received are located here. If you accept a challenge from another player a game will be created. Private messages are used as an alternative way to communicate with other players when in-game chat is not available.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Players section.

Players section

This section contains list of all players and their profiles. Filters that are located in the upper-center part of the screen can be used to search for specific players that match only the selected filter criteria.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Replays section.

Replays section

All games are recorded and stored for players to watch later. Here, you can review your games to improve your skills or watch games of other players to learn from their tactics. Filters that are located in the upper-center part of the screen can be used to search for specific game replays.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Forum section.

Forum section

MArcomage has it's own discussion forum. If you have any questions regarding MArcomage, ask other players in the General section of the forum. If you encounter problems with MArcomage, you can report the issues in the Support section of our forum.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Cards section.

Cards section

MArcomage entire card database can be viewed here. Filters located in the upper-center part of the screen can be used to find specific cards.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Card concepts section.

Card concepts section

All players can create new cards and submit them for implementation. Also, card concepts of other players can be viewed here as well.

Once you're ready click on the Next button to continue to Settings section.

Settings section

In this section you can customize MArcomage. Profile settings contain information about your identity, none of them is mandatory. When filled in, all other players are able to see this information. Account settings are used to adjust MArcomage to your best liking. Additionally, MArcomage shop is located here, right below the profile settings. In the shop you can buy additional features such as bonus game and deck slots.

This concludes our tutorial. Please see the Game manual (Help section) for more detailed information about MArcomage.

Once you're ready click on the Finish tutorial button to end the tutorial. This tutorial can be restarted by pressing the Restart tutorial button in the Settings section.
